titleStmt.title: William Allen to J. W. Finnell
CWG1675

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Appointments by the Governor, Civil Appointments, 1863-1867

body.p:
Head-Qrs. Pay Dist. of the Cumberland,
Louisville, Ky., Sept 1st 1863.
Hon. J. W. Finnell
Adjt Genl. Ky.
Frankfort, Ky.
Sir-
I have the honor to state, that my clerk David C. Porter, whom the Gov. appointed Notary Public early in 1862, has resigned his office & will leave me soon.

It is very necessary that I should have a Notary Public in my office & one of my own clerks. You will do me a great favor, by forwarding a commission to my brother Robert Allen- now clerk in my office, as Notary Public.

I, am, Very Respectfully
Your Obedt. Servt.
William Allen,
Chief Paymaster Dist Cumberland.
Jefferson Co.
D. C. Porter
Robt. Allen
Notary Public
Appd. Sept 2.
1863
